stories.headline: Sticker shocked
stories.summary: An in-depth analysis by The Seattle Times showed that despite soaring house prices, properties are more affordable due to rising incomes and falling interest rates. The eight-part series 'Sticker Shocked' broke down housing trends by neighborhood and revealed significant price increases in certain Seattle areas.

stories.headline: Inmate imports
stories.summary: An investigative report exposing that Tennessee's private prisons were accepting a disproportionately high number of violent criminals from Wisconsin, including murderers and sex offenders, based on data analysis of inmate records.

stories.headline: Neighborhood blight
stories.author_title: Reporter for St. Paul Pioneer Press
stories.summary: The St. Paul Pioneer Press used mapping and inspection data to reveal the extent of neighborhood blight in St. Paul, sparking changes in housing inspections and enforcement policies.

stories.headline: Big Apple rents
stories.author_title: Reporter for New York Daily News
stories.summary: A comprehensive analysis of the New York City rental market shows rent increases over the 1990s, using Census Bureau data and highlighting significant rent hikes in certain Manhattan neighborhoods.
